result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew R Garcia was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by 6/29/2017; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by 6/29/2017*; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Restitution set at zero.

Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 86 days time served.  This is a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.
No drivers license suspension.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew R Garcia

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Matthew R Garcia in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Matthew R Garcia in custody.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Defendant  advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

  The Court ordered the Defendant to:
-Serve 86 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 86 days time served.  This is a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by 6/29/2017; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by 6/29/2017*; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Restitution set at zero
-No drivers license suspension
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Final Pretrial held. Case remains on the calendr for Jury Trial on 6/29/2015.

Filed:
State's Witness List, State's Requested Jury Instructions, State's Motion in Limine, Defendant's Requested Jury Instructions, Defendant's Witness List. sab

Defendant Matthew R Garcia in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Matthew R Garcia in custody.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
On motion of the State, Court amended the Information to add "As a Party to a Crime", pursuant to Wis Stat 939.05.

Attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs in court, defendant Matthew R Garcia not in court, in custody.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  AA.   Case is adjourned for final pretrial conference and for jury trial in Branch 15.  Filed, signed Felony Pretrial Scheduling Order.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs in court, defendant Matthew R Garcia not in court, in custody.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
State to provide the defense with additional discovery. Case calendared for STATUS on 5/8/2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.
Speedy trial demand. (Defense Counsel previously selected scheduling conference date with co-counsel, prior to entering speedy trial demand.)

Defendant Matthew R Garcia in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Matthew R Garcia in custody.  Zachary Wittchow for Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Sergio Rentas-MPD Officer.  Exhibits 1 and 2 are marked, offered and received into evidenc.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 15. Exhibits are ordered withdrawn.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing. No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Matthew R Garcia in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Matthew R Garcia in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
